abstract: Kenneth D. Lewis spoke with the New York attorney general’s office about $3.6 billion in bonuses handed out to Merrill Lynch employees on the eve of its merger with the bank last year.
snippet: Kenneth D. Lewis spoke with the New York attorney general’s office about $3.6 billion in bonuses handed out to Merrill Lynch employees on the eve of its merger with the bank last year.
lead_paragraph: Kenneth D. Lewis, the chief executive of Bank of America, testified in a meeting with the New York attorney general’s office for four hours on Thursday about $3.6 billion in bonuses handed out to Merrill Lynch employees on the eve of its merger with the bank last year.

headline.main: Bank of America Chief Testifies on Bonuses
